001package es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction;
002
003import java.io.Closeable;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.Writer;
006import java.nio.charset.Charset;
007import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
008import java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException;
009import java.nio.file.FileVisitOption;
010import java.nio.file.FileVisitResult;
011import java.nio.file.Files;
012import java.nio.file.Path;
013import java.nio.file.SimpleFileVisitor;
014import java.nio.file.attribute.BasicFileAttributes;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Collections;
018import java.util.EnumSet;
019import java.util.HashMap;
020import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Locale;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.Map.Entry;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.stream.Collectors;
027
028import org.apache.commons.csv.CSVFormat;
029import org.apache.commons.csv.CSVParser;
030import org.apache.commons.csv.CSVRecord;
031
032import edu.stanford.nlp.patterns.GetPatternsFromDataMultiClass;
033import lombok.AccessLevel;
034import lombok.AllArgsConstructor;
035import lombok.Getter;
036import lombok.NonNull;
037
038/**
039 * Contains helper methods for dealing with the contents of preexisting,
040 * internal use named entity dictionaries.
041 *
042 * @author Alejandro González García
043 */
044final class NamedEntityDictionaryHelper {
045        private static final CSVFormat DICTIONARY_FILE_FORMAT;
046        private static final Charset DICTIONARY_FILE_CHARSET = StandardCharsets.UTF_8;
047        private static final String MALFORMED_INPUT_RECORD_ERROR_FORMAT_STR = "Malformed input record at line %d, file %s: %s";
048
049        static {
050                // The format for dictionary files, which essentially is TSV.
051                // This specification deviates a bit from the IANA standard,
052                // but it is backwards compatible with it:
053                // https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/tab-separated-values
054                DICTIONARY_FILE_FORMAT = CSVFormat.TDF
055                        .withRecordSeparator('\n')
056                        .withCommentMarker('#')
057                        .withFirstRecordAsHeader()
058                        .withAllowMissingColumnNames(false)
059                        .withEscape('\\')
060                        .withIgnoreHeaderCase()
061                        .withIgnoreEmptyLines();
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Disallows instantiation of this class.
066         */
067        private NamedEntityDictionaryHelper() {}
068
069        /**
070         * Walks through the specified root file system path and its children, searching
071         * for TSV files, and parses them as named entity dictionaries, adding the terms
072         * they contain to a map. The entity type label for the terms in a file is the
073         * file name in upper case.
074         *
075         * @param rootPath The root path whose children files will be scanned for
076         *                 entities. Subdirectories will be ignored. Normally this path
077         *                 is a directory, but it can also be a regular file, in which
078         *                 case it will be the only file that is visited.
079         * @return An unmodifiable map whose keys are the entity type labels which have
080         *         at least a term, and the associated value is a set of terms for that
081         *         label.
082         * @throws IOException              If some I/O error occurs during the
083         *                                  operation.
084         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code rootPath} is {@code null}.
085         */
086        public static Map<String, Set<NamedEntityTerm>> namedEntitiesFromPathChildren(@NonNull final Path rootPath) throws IOException {
087                final Map<String, Set<NamedEntityTerm>> labelTerms = new HashMap<>();
088
089                Files.walkFileTree(
090                        rootPath,
091                        EnumSet.of(FileVisitOption.FOLLOW_LINKS), // Resolve symbolic links to give the operator extra flexibility
092                        1, // Do not walk into subdirectories
093                        new SimpleFileVisitor<>() {
094                                @Override
095                                public FileVisitResult visitFile(final Path file, final BasicFileAttributes attrs) throws IOException {
096                                        final String fileName = file.getFileName().toString();
097                                        final String entityLabel = fileName.substring(
098                                                0, Math.max(fileName.length() - 4, 0)
099                                        ).toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT);
100
101                                        // Only consider files with .tsv extension, ignoring case
102                                        if (!Files.isDirectory(file) && fileName.substring(Math.max(fileName.length() - 4, 0)).equalsIgnoreCase(".tsv")) {
103                                                try (final CSVParser tsvParser = DICTIONARY_FILE_FORMAT.parse(
104                                                        Files.newBufferedReader(file, DICTIONARY_FILE_CHARSET)
105                                                )) {
106                                                        final List<String> headerFieldNames = Arrays.stream(DictionaryFileFields.values())
107                                                                .map(DictionaryFileFields::toString)
108                                                                .collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableList());
109
110                                                        if (!tsvParser.getHeaderNames().containsAll(headerFieldNames)) {
111                                                                throw new IOException("Not all required fields are present in the header");
112                                                        }
113
114                                                        for (final CSVRecord record : tsvParser) {
115                                                                final String term = record.get(DictionaryFileFields.TERM);
116                                                                final String synonyms;
117
118                                                                try {
119                                                                        synonyms = record.get(DictionaryFileFields.SYNONYMS);
120                                                                } catch (final IllegalArgumentException exc) {
121                                                                        throw new IOException(
122                                                                                String.format(
123                                                                                        MALFORMED_INPUT_RECORD_ERROR_FORMAT_STR,
124                                                                                        tsvParser.getCurrentLineNumber(), file,
125                                                                                        "missing synonyms"
126                                                                                )
127                                                                        );
128                                                                }
129
130                                                                // The term is required, and can't be blank
131                                                                if (term == null || term.isBlank()) {
132                                                                        throw new IOException(
133                                                                                String.format(
134                                                                                        MALFORMED_INPUT_RECORD_ERROR_FORMAT_STR,
135                                                                                        tsvParser.getCurrentLineNumber(), file,
136                                                                                        "missing term"
137                                                                                )
138                                                                        );
139                                                                }
140
141                                                                final Set<NamedEntityTerm> terms = labelTerms.computeIfAbsent(
142                                                                        entityLabel, (final String key) -> new LinkedHashSet<>()
143                                                                );
144                                                                final String[] synonymArray = synonyms.split(",");
145                                                                final Set<String> synonymList = new LinkedHashSet<>(
146                                                                        (int) Math.ceil(synonymArray.length / 0.75)
147                                                                );
148
149                                                                // Add the term and its synonyms to the term set for this label.
150                                                                // Ignore empty synonyms, if they are present, because they are meaningless
151                                                                for (final String synonym : synonymArray) {
152                                                                        String normalizedSynonym;
153
154                                                                        if (
155                                                                                !synonym.isBlank() &&
156                                                                                // Make sure the synonym is not an already registered term
157                                                                                !terms.contains(
158                                                                                        new NamedEntityTerm(
159                                                                                                normalizedSynonym = synonym.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT),
160                                                                                                Set.of()
161                                                                                        )
162                                                                                )
163                                                                        ) {
164                                                                                synonymList.add(normalizedSynonym);
165                                                                        }
166                                                                }
167                                                                terms.add(
168                                                                        new NamedEntityTerm(
169                                                                                term.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT),
170                                                                                Collections.unmodifiableSet(synonymList)
171                                                                        )
172                                                                );
173                                                        }
174                                                }
175                                        }
176
177                                        return FileVisitResult.CONTINUE;
178                                }
179                        }
180                );
181
182                return Collections.unmodifiableMap(labelTerms);
183        }
184
185        /**
186         * Converts the specified named entity map, as returned by
187         * {@link #namedEntitiesFromPathChildren(Path)}, to a seed words files property
188         * that can be passed to SPIED ({@link GetPatternsFromDataMultiClass}) for
189         * further processing. The seed words files specified in the property will be
190         * created in the temporary directory reported by the operating system, and
191         * should be cleaned up when they are no longer necessary by calling
192         * {@link es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction.NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles#close()}
193         * explicitly or implicitly (for instance, in a try-with-resources block).
194         *
195         * @param labelTerms The map that associates named entity type labels with its
196         *                   terms, as returned by
197         *                   {@link #namedEntitiesFromPathChildren(Path)}.
198         * @return The property to pass to SPIED, whose value can be retrieved by
199         *         calling
200         *         {@link es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction.NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles#getValue()}.
201         * @throws IOException              If some I/O error occurs during the
202         *                                  operation.
203         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code labelTerms} is {@code null}.
204         */
205        public static PropertyWithTemporaryFiles namedEntitiesToSeedWordsFilesProperty(@NonNull final Map<String, Set<NamedEntityTerm>> labelTerms) throws IOException {
206                final StringBuilder propertyValueBuilder = new StringBuilder();
207                final List<Path> temporaryFilePaths = new ArrayList<>();
208
209                final Path tempDir = Files.createTempDirectory("TP_NEDH");
210                // Delete the temporary folder on normal VM exit
211                // if we don't do that before (we should)
212                tempDir.toFile().deleteOnExit();
213
214                for (final Entry<String, Set<NamedEntityTerm>> namedEntitiesEntry : labelTerms.entrySet()) {
215                        final Path tempFile = Files.createTempFile(tempDir, namedEntitiesEntry.getKey(), null);
216
217                        // The default charset is the one that will be used by CoreNLP,
218                        // as it delegates the choice to the InputStreamReader one argument constructor
219                        try (final Writer fileWriter = Files.newBufferedWriter(tempFile, Charset.defaultCharset())) {
220                                for (final NamedEntityTerm term : namedEntitiesEntry.getValue()) {
221                                        fileWriter.write(term.getTerm());
222                                        fileWriter.write('\n'); // CoreNLP IOUtils uses BufferedReader for reading lines
223
224                                        for (final String synonym : term.getSynonyms()) {
225                                                fileWriter.write(synonym);
226                                                fileWriter.write('\n');
227                                        }
228                                }
229                        }
230
231                        propertyValueBuilder
232                                .append(namedEntitiesEntry.getKey())
233                                .append(',')
234                                .append(tempFile.toRealPath().toString())
235                                .append(';');
236
237                        temporaryFilePaths.add(tempFile);
238
239                        // Delete the files in the folder too, because it is not specified that
240                        // deleting a folder with deleteOnExit deletes its files recursively
241                        tempFile.toFile().deleteOnExit();
242                }
243
244                // Remove trailing ";"
245                if (propertyValueBuilder.length() > 0) {
246                        propertyValueBuilder.deleteCharAt(propertyValueBuilder.length() - 1);
247                }
248
249                return new PropertyWithTemporaryFiles(
250                        propertyValueBuilder.toString(),
251                        Collections.unmodifiableList(temporaryFilePaths)
252                );
253        }
254
255        /**
256         * Holds the value for a property, and also provides a {@link #close()} method
257         * to release temporary files created for this property.
258         *
259         * @author Alejandro González García
260         */
261        @AllArgsConstructor(access = AccessLevel.PRIVATE)
262        public static final class PropertyWithTemporaryFiles implements Closeable {
263                @NonNull @Getter
264                private final String value;
265                @NonNull
266                private final List<Path> temporaryFilePaths;
267
268                @Override
269                public void close() throws IOException {
270                        for (final Path path : temporaryFilePaths) {
271                                try {
272                                        Files.deleteIfExists(path);
273                                } catch (final DirectoryNotEmptyException ignored) {}
274                        }
275                }
276        }
277
278        /**
279         * Represents a named entity term, which can have synonyms. Two named entity
280         * terms are equal as per the {@link #equals(Object)} method if and only if the
281         * term they represent is equal, without considering synonym lists.
282         *
283         * @author Alejandro González García
284         */
285        @AllArgsConstructor(access = AccessLevel.PRIVATE)
286        public static final class NamedEntityTerm {
287                @NonNull @Getter
288                private final String term;
289                @NonNull @Getter
290                private final Set<String> synonyms;
291
292                @Override
293                public int hashCode() {
294                        return term.hashCode();
295                }
296
297                @Override
298                public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
299                        return obj instanceof NamedEntityTerm &&
300                                term.equals(((NamedEntityTerm) obj).term);
301                }
302        }
303
304        /**
305         * Represents the fields that each record in a named entity dictionary file can
306         * contain.
307         *
308         * @author Alejandro González García
309         */
310        private static enum DictionaryFileFields {
311                /**
312                 * The term field, which contains a term.
313                 */
314                TERM,
315                /**
316                 * A list of synonyms for the term, separated by a comma.
317                 */
318                SYNONYMS;
319
320                @Override
321                public String toString() {
322                        return name().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
323                }
324        }
325}
